assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Indicate the resident's USUAL ability with everyday activities PRIOR to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

questions.questionText: Self-Care: Code the resident's need for assistance with bathing, dressing, using the toilet, or eating prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

responseOptions.responseText: Dependent - A helper completed all the activities for the resident.
Needed Some Help - Resident needed partial assistance from another person to complete any activities.
Independent - Resident completed all the activities by themself, with or without an assistive device, with no assistance from a helper.

questions.questionText: Indoor Mobility (Ambulation): Code the resident's need for assistance with walking from room to room (with or without a device such as cane, crutch, or walker) prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

responseOptions.responseText: Dependent - A helper completed all the activities for the resident.
Needed Some Help - Resident needed partial assistance from another person to complete any activities.
Independent - Resident completed all the activities by themself, with or without an assistive device, with no assistance from a helper.

questions.questionText: Stairs: Code the resident's need for assistance with internal or external stairs (with or without a device such as cane, crutch, or walker) prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

responseOptions.responseText: Dependent - A helper completed all the activities for the resident.
Needed Some Help - Resident needed partial assistance from another person to complete any activities.
Independent - Resident completed all the activities by themself, with or without an assistive device, with no assistance from a helper.

questions.questionText: Functional Cognition: Code the resident's need for assistance with planning regular tasks, such as shopping or remembering to take medication prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

responseOptions.responseText: Dependent - A helper completed all the activities for the resident.
Needed Some Help - Resident needed partial assistance from another person to complete any activities.
Independent - Resident completed all the activities by themself, with or without an assistive device, with no assistance from a helper.

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Indicate the devices and aids used by the resident PRIOR to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.

questions.questionText: Manual wheelchair
Motorized wheelchair and/or scooter
Mechanical lift
Walker
Orthotics/Prosthetics
None of the above

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Code for limitation that interfered with daily functions or placed resident at risk of injury in last 7 days
assessmentQuestionGroups.groupTitle: Functional Limitation in Range of Motion

questions.questionText:
0. No Impairment
1. Impairment on one side
2. Impairment on both sides
Upper extremity (shoulder, elbow, wrist, hand)
Lower extremity (hip, knee, ankle, foot)

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Indicate the resident's USUAL ability with everyday activities prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.
Check all that were normally used in the last 7 days

questions.questionText: Cane/crutch
Walker
Wheelchair (manual or electric)
Limb prosthesis
None of the above were used

For each ADL listed below, the Interdisciplinary Team will discuss and code the resident's USUAL performance for DAYS 1-3 using the responses provided below. Activities may be completed with or without assistive devices. May obtain data by resident observation or resident interview.
If the activity did not occur, code the appropriate reason.
The Interdisplinary Team will discuss and choose at least ONE Discharge Goal with resident's input as able.
Eating: The ability to use suitable utensils to bring food and/or liquid to the mouth and swallow food and/or liquid once the meal is placed before the resident. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Oral hygiene: The ability to use suitable items to clean teeth. Dentures (if applicable): The ability to insert and remove dentures into and from the mouth, and manage denture soaking and rinsing with use of equipment. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Toileting hygiene: The ability to maintain perineal hygiene, adjust clothes before and after voiding or having a bowel movement. If managing an ostomy, include wiping the opening but not managing equipment. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Shower/bathe self: The ability to bathe self, including washing, rinsing, and drying self (excludes washing of back and hair). Does not include transferring in/out of tub/shower. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Upper body dressing: The ability to dress and undress above the waist; including fasteners, if applicable. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Lower body dressing: The ability to dress and undress below the waist, including fasteners; does not include footwear. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Putting on/taking off footwear: The ability to put on and take off socks and shoes or other footwear that is appropriate for safe mobility; including fasteners, if applicable. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Personal Hygiene (Start of Stay Perf)

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupText: Resident completes the activity with no assistance from a helper.

questions.questionText: For each ADL listed below, code the resident's USUAL performance for DAYS 1-3 using the responses provided below. Activities may be completed with or without assistive devices. May obtain data through resident observation or resident interview.
<b>If the activity did not occur on your shift, code the appropriate reason.
The Interdisplinary Team will discuss and choose at least ONE Discharge Goal with resident's input as able.
Walk 50 feet with two turns: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Walk 150 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Walking 10 feet on uneven surfaces: The ability to walk 10 feet on uneven or sloping surfaces (indoor or outdoor), such as turf or gravel. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: 1 step (curb): The ability to go up and down a curb and/or up and down one step. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: 4 steps: The ability to go up and down four steps with or without a rail. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: 12 steps: The ability to go up and down 12 steps with or without a rail. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Picking up object: The ability to bend/stoop from a standing position to pick up a small object, such as a spoon, from the floor. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Does the resident use a wheelchair and/or scooter? - Admission Performance
Wheel 50 feet with two turns: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 50 feet and make two turns. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Indicate the type of wheelchair or scooter used. - Admission Performance
Wheel 150 feet: Once seated in wheelchair/scooter, the ability to wheel at least 150 feet in a corridor or similar space. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Indicate the type of wheelchair or scooter used. - Admission Performance
Roll left and right: The ability to roll from lying on back to left and right side, and return to lying on back on the bed. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Sit to lying: The ability to move from sitting on side of bed to lying flat on the bed. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

assessmentQuestionGroups.groupTitle: Lying to Sitting on Side of the Bed

questions.questionText: Lying to sitting on side of bed: The ability to move from lying on the back to sitting on the side of the bed with feet flat on the floor, and with no back support. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Sit to stand: The ability to come to a standing position from sitting in a chair, wheelchair, or on the side of the bed. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Chair/bed-to-chair transfer: The ability to transfer to and from a bed to a chair (or wheelchair). - Admission Performance

Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Toilet transfer: The ability to get on and off a toilet or commode. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations

questions.questionText: Car transfer: The ability to transfer in and out of a car or van on the passenger side. Does not include the ability to open/close door or fasten seat belt. - Admission Performance

responseOptions.responseText: Not attempted due to environmental limitations
Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns

questions.questionText: Walk 10 feet: Once standing, the ability to walk at least 10 feet in a room, corridor, or similar space. - Admission Performance
